short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Find Resources with Expired Domains While Browsing.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension will notify you when a page that you've browsed has a potentially expired or vulnerable (to DNS hijacking) domain in one of its resources. This is a great way to find vulnerabilities for free while you browse.

For example, if example.com includes expired-domain-name.info via a <script> tag, this extension will detect that.

For this extension to work it performs DNS NS queries to all base domains of all sub-resources of pages you browse. If the request results in an NXDOMAIN/SERVFAIL/REFUSED response then the domain is considered potentially vulnerable. This is done via Google's DNS-over-HTTPS public server. If you're not comfortable using Google to perform these DNS validations, this extension is not for you.

Not that false-positives can occur, please use the "Confirm this result on..." buttons to validate the initial DNS findings.
